Key Match Events: Mama Balde scored for Guinea-Bissau in the 42nd minute
Salah scored for Egypt in the 70th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Guinea-Bissau have kept consecutive clean sheets against Djibouti and Ethiopia
Egypt have kept consecutive clean sheets and are circa 30 minutes from a third before Lassina Traore halved the deficit in Cairo
Guinea-Bissau could even make a play for first spot by defeating the Pharaohs on Monday
Success for Egypt increases their advantage in Group A, thus motivating Hassan's men to outdo their opponents in the fourth round of fixtures
Post-Match Reflections: Despite Guinea-Bissau keeping two clean sheets in qualifying after three games, Monday's encounter could end Djurtus' undefeated run with Egypt's superior quality giving them the edge in Bissau
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houboulang Mendes, sent off after two yellows against Djibouti in November 2023, should return to the squad on Monday
Mohamed Salah's return to the fold, the Liverpool forward has not netted for the Pharaohs since their Africa Cup of Nations opening match against Mozambique in January
Others: Guinea-Bissau's start to World Cup qualifying has them second in Group A after three matches
Egypt's only loss in their last 14 World Cup qualifying matches came in their double-header with Senegal in the lead-up to the 2022 finals
